sub_title: Senior Film Editor | Co-Founder & Story teller Bongkar met Wongkar | Dei advocate
summary:
Hi there,

I'm Chee-Han /Tea'hahn/ and I'm a freelance film editor with almost 15 years of editing experience. I focus on cutting short format content such as TV commercials, short documentaries, fashion films and other content for social media. I also have experience with long formats like TV-shows for Fox' 24Kitchen and for Hulu TV where I've edited Fashion & beauty TV series. I'm proud to have worked for award-winning companies like Whitehouse Post, Passion London and Wieden+Kennedy on global high end brands such as Apple, Coca-Cola, Adidas and Playstation.

Besides my passion for editing I also like to engage with topics and themes related to cultural diversity and inclusion. I do this by giving talks and lectures on Editing, representation & inclusion. I love sharing my knowledge as an Editor and show examples of how to establish and contribute to a more inclusive  process. 

As a media maker I also focus on a more diverse and inclusive representation of gender and ethnicity. In 2019 my partner Reza and I wrote a children's book called "Where Is My Noodle Soup?!?". It's a culturally inclusive children's book and the very first Dutch children's book featuring an Asian Dutch main character. Our book has been extremely well received and our publisher ROSE Stories did a fifth printing within only 1,5 years. And in 2021 I received a Silver Lamp at the Dutch Creativity Awards in the category Society - Diversity, inclusion & equity for my awareness project The Invisible Ones with the video #ISpyWithMyLittleEye that went viral during the corona pandemic. 

Finally, as a public speaker I like to talk about and discuss topics such as (mis)representation in the media where I like to put advertising in the center of attention as that's the field where I have gained most of my experiences and insights from. The difference between authentic and sincere diversity and just a symbolic gesture is the team behind the campaigns. Diversity in the work environment is a must. If you want to hear more of my thoughts I'm happy to drop by for a presentation.

treasury_media.title: Community Top100 - Creatives #1 Chee-Han Kartosen-Wong
treasury_media.description: De Community Top 100 is een onafhankelijk platform en wordt elk jaar samengesteld door een journalistieke redactie en uitgegeven door mediaproductiehuis Mr & Mrs OASIS. De Community Top 100 creëert content die het verhaal vertelt van verschillende communities met cultuur sensitieve context en zonder stereotyperingen.

treasury_media.title: BM-Talk Chee-Han Kartosen-Wong
treasury_media.description: Chee-Han is content creator, commercial filmeditor, spreker en schrijver, onder andere van het kinderboek Waar Is Mijn Noedelsoep?!?, zonder clichés over Aziaten. De discussie over diversiteit houdt haar flink bezig, zeker in de commerciële (adverteerders)hoek.

awards.title: De Community Top 100 - Creatives #1
awards.description: “Chee-Han is een creatieve duizendpoot die alle kennis die ze als video-editor heeft opgedaan bij bureaus en productiemaatschappijen in Londen nu inzet in de Nederlandse context – ook als het gaat om diversiteit en inclusie. Ze is een van de weinige Nederlandse editors die bewust omgaat met het thema tijdens het maakproces. In de tv-commercials en andere content die ze maakt is dat ook terug te zien.”

Role: Film Editor

profile_positions.description:
As a freelance film editor I cut commercials, documentaries and films. I started out in advertising cutting mainly short format content such as TV commercials and brand films. After a while I started to work for post-production, broadcast companies and also directly with brands, cutting more different content like music videos, documentaries, food series and fashion films and this summer a feature film. 

I work in Amsterdam, London and other places, wherever I'm needed. Multiple productions I have worked on have been rewarded with international advertising and media awards such as Cannes Lions, Epica, The One, Prix Europe and more. Besides editing I also do supervision work. I oversee the workload and manage junior and assistant editors. 

Since 2022 I've been actively looking and hiring female editors of colour. I mentor them and guide them in the high end post production industry as I believe the industry need more balance.

Apple, Coca Cola, Adidas, Asics, Tommy, Calvin Klein, BMW, NIKE, W+K, 72andSunny, TBWA, Halal, New Amsterdam, 24Kitchen, Whitehouse London and Passion Raw are just a few names of companies and brands I've worked for. For a preview of my work please visit my website www.chee-han.com
profile_positions.title: Senior Film Editor & Supervisor

profile_positions.description:
Bongkar met Wongkar creates and develops projects and campaigns with a focus on cultural diversity and inclusion. We give public talks about stereotypes in media from a commercial or academic point of view. And we also act as consultants on film and TV projects. 

Our very first project started with a children's book "Where is my noodle soup?!?". An inclusive book for 3 to 6 years old with the very first Asian Dutch main character that's not represented in a stereotypical way. With this book we counter stereotyping and food shaming by showing kids and parents how wonderful it is to share and taste new food from different cultures. The book has been received extremely well by the public. Our second book "Fried rice with everything and anything!!!" has been received equally as warm. 

Besides children's book we also like to speak out through story telling. We've created and produced the awareness video "I spy with my little eye" to stop discrimination towards Asian Dutch minorities. The video went viral and has been awarded with a Silver Lamp at the Dutch Creativity Awards (ADCN).

 For more information about our work and services please visit our website www.bongkarmetwongkar.nl
profile_positions.title: Co-founder, Crossmedia story teller & Public speaker -  Winner Silver Lamp

profile_positions.description:
I give guest lectures about Film Editing & Diversity for the University of Utrecht (Television Production) and University of Amsterdam (Media studies). 

I talk about editing and what kind of influence an editor can have in the final outcome of a tv-program, tv-serie or commercial, highlighting diversity in race and gender.
profile_positions.title: Guest Lecturer - Editing, Diversity & Inclusivity

profile_positions.description: True Stories of investing is directed by Lyangelo Vasquez who researched the history of investing and found some interesting stories with fascinating people to talk about them. These trade experts, professors and investors give first-hand insight into the basic principles of trading. Creating a documentary and spin-off add campaign. Democratise the trade markets and giving financial power to ordinary people around the world.

profile_positions.description: PAKKEMBEET is founded by the two sisters Chee-Han and Wai-Han Wong. Being mums they were looking for a bag which is big and easy to carry their children things but also strong enough to carry groceries and laptops. With Chee-Han's creative background they've designed together strong canvas bags made of 100% eco cotton. The bags come in two versions and are sold online and in stores.
